intro: Fumaria macrocarpa var. oxyloba, commonly known as the greater celandine, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and swollen, fleshy stems. The plant has alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
